us.phonetic: /adj., n. ˈpɝfɪkt; v. pɚˈfɛkt/, (adj., n. pûr′fikt; v. pər fekt′)

example.eg: His English is perfect.
We had a perfect day today.
example.egtrans: 我们今天过得太完满了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 完满的, 极佳的, 完美的

example.eg: Yes, this book is perfect.  It answers all my questions.
example.egtrans: 对，这本书真是太理想了。回答了我所有问题。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 理想的, 完全符合要求的

example.eg: The object is a perfect sphere, with every point on the surface at an equal distance to the centre.
example.egtrans: 这个物体是完全的球形，表面上每个点到中心的距离都相等。

example.eg: A perfect number is equal to the sum of its proper factors.
example.egtrans: 完全数是其真因子的总和。

example.eg: He is a perfect idiot.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 地道的, 十足的, 完全的

example.eg: Should I use the present perfect or the past perfect tense here?
example.egtrans: 这里应该用现在完成时还是过去完成时？

example.eg: He practiced every day to perfect his shot.
example.egtrans: 他每天练习，以完善自己的投球技术。

us.phonetic: /adj., n. ˈpɝfɪkt; v. pɚˈfɛkt/, (adj., n. pûr′fikt; v. pər fekt′)

example.eg: She has perfect pitch - she never sings flat or sharp.
The perfect fifth was the first harmony introduced in singing.
A perfect flower contains both male and female structures.
She didn't know whether to use the perfect or the simple past.

us.phonetic: /adj., n. ˈpɝfɪkt; v. pɚˈfɛkt/, (adj., n. pûr′fikt; v. pər fekt′)

dsense.name: past perfect
dsense.guideword: (grammar: pluperfect, verb tense of action previously completed)

example.eg: We use the past perfect to say that one action happened before another.
Strawberries and goat cheese made the perfect combination of flavor and texture.

dsense.name: perfect competition
dsense.guideword: (when neither producer nor consumer controls price)

example.eg: Perfect competition is an economic theory and assumes many small producers and consumers with perfect information, therefore the market sets the price.
This t-shirt is a perfect fit.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 完全合适的东西，完美兼容的东西

example.eg: 6 is a perfect number because 1+2+3 = 6.

dsense.name: perfect pitch
dsense.guideword: (ability to identify a musical note) (能准确分布每个音的具体音高)

example.eg: My brother had perfect pitch as a child but as an adult, it went down or up by a third.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 祸不单行, 极其糟糕的情况

example.eg: In English, perfect tenses are formed with the auxiliary "have" and a past participle.
She cleaned her house until it was picture-perfect.

dsense.name: present perfect
dsense.guideword: (tense: have been doing, etc.) (语法现象)

example.eg: The present perfect is used for situations that began in the past and have continued until the present.

dsense.name: present perfect tense, present perfect
dsense.guideword: (grammar: have been, etc.) (语法结构为：have + 过去分词)

example.eg: In this exercise, students have to decide whether to use the present perfect tense or the past simple tense.
